body_html:
We're going through some API churn as we try to stabilize things for the 1.0 release (and can provide stability for all 1.x release as per our versioning policy). See RELEASE.md for changes.

In this particular case:
tf.inv has been renamed to be tf.reciprocal (component-wise reciprocal) to avoid confusion with np.inv which is matrix inversion.

Apologies for the churn, once we hit 1.0, things should be much more stable.

Hope that help!
body_text:
We're going through some API churn as we try to stabilize things for the 1.0 release (and can provide stability for all 1.x release as per our versioning policy). See RELEASE.md for changes.
In this particular case:
tf.inv has been renamed to be tf.reciprocal (component-wise reciprocal) to avoid confusion with np.inv which is matrix inversion.
Apologies for the churn, once we hit 1.0, things should be much more stable.
Hope that help!
body:
We're going through some API churn as we try to stabilize things for the 1.0 release (and can provide stability for all 1.x release as per our [versioning policy](https://www.tensorflow.org/resources/versions)). See [RELEASE.md](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/RELEASE.md) for changes.

In this particular case:
`tf.inv` has been renamed to be `tf.reciprocal` (component-wise reciprocal) to avoid confusion with `np.inv` which is matrix inversion.

Apologies for the churn, once we hit 1.0, things should be much more stable.

Hope that help!
